yelp_reviews.author: Condo O.
yelp_reviews.review:
Integra has been managing our condo association for about 3 years.  I am disappointed at their idea of increasing the sales appeal of our units by hiding the costs to new buyers who want to live here.  They are aware that high HOA fees are a deterrence to buyers so they suggest to the board lower HOA fees paired with regular annual assessments to fill the reserve funding.  This seems like bait and switch to me, but our board doesn't see this as an act of deception. 

If you are buying a condo make sure you ask if there have been any recent assessments in addition to the HOA fees which are usually published so you understand the actual cost of living in the unit you are considering.

yelp_reviews.author: Michael P.
yelp_reviews.review:
Where do I start?

Worst Property Management Company EVER!!!!

She is a very Unlikeable person who has a SERIOUS attitude!!
She forgets that she works for the people at Bay Rim and I had a few words with her and we decided we were going to move... which we did!
Worst experience of our lives!!!!
If you need a company to manage your Property...find someone else!!!
They charge you for EVERYTHING!!
Move In fees...Move Out fees....total BS if you ask me!
I've worked in Property Management and this is NOT how you handle a Portfolio!!!
Do yourselves a favor and stay clear on Integra!!!!!!
If I could give NO Stars I would

yelp_reviews.author: Nanette J.
yelp_reviews.review: I spoke with a woman today named Peggy. She was probably the rudest person I have had to encounter in a long time. I regret that I may have to talk to her again in the future but I can tell you that I will refuse to talk to her. She is definitely a very unhappy person and in the wrong line of work. She tried to belittle me over the phone and that is just not going to happen again. I feel sorry for this company that has this person as their first point of contact.

yelp_reviews.author: Bob D.
yelp_reviews.review:
This is the worst rental management company I have ever had to deal with.  

They will steal your application fee. They take application fees to apartments they know they will not be renting to you, and refuse to refund you your money.

Their customer service is terrible. They will not let you know important information. They will not contact you when there is information you should know about your lease. They charge you for every little thing they can, don't give any of your security deposit back, and charge you fines until you have paid an extra $200/month in fees. 

There was no reason for them to treat me this way. I consistently turned in my rent on time, paid all of my bills and was a quiet and respectful tenant. 

I can only hope this stops people from using them as a property management company or from renting from them. It is not worth it.

yelp_reviews.review:
We have had nothing but amazing service from Integra during our 6 years with them! I wish they could take over the rest of our condo association!!!
My admiration of them went up even more recently when they took over and handeled everything for us when our tenants abandoned the unit. They're AMAZING!!!!!!!

yelp_reviews.author: R F.
yelp_reviews.review: Haven't even bought the condo under their management yet and I already don't like them. I called to ask questions and Tess could not have been less helpful. She just kept saying "did you read the certificate?" Yes. I did. It is a legal doc and I just wanted quick clarification because, Hey, Tess, this is your area of expertise, not mine! I think you could do with a course in customer service skills because that is my area and you would be fired! I am buying a condo and can't wait to recommend that Integra be replaced!

yelp_reviews.author: C H.
yelp_reviews.review: I hope this prevents another person from applying for a rental from Integra.  They are the worst landlord company in Bellingham.  They will take your application fee knowing a listing has already been promised to a different tenant.  It's really akin to theft.  They are rude and unresponsive.  Yuck!  Stay away from this landlord!!!  If I could have given them 0 stars, I would have.

yelp_reviews.author: Nicholas E.
yelp_reviews.review: Not sure how Jenn X. could rate this company five stars? Maybe she is a friend of the company or didn't have many real encounters with them. I wouldn't even give the 1 star if I could. I echo the sentiments exactly of all the other 1 star reviews. I wanna thank these people for leaving these reviews because this company is downright unethical. Terrible service, rude, they will lie and make up stories and do just about anything to get out of taking care of the things they are supposed to take care of. Definitely my worst experience ever with a property management company. You know when so many reviews in a row are one star and all say the same thing you should steer clear. Stay away. Also look at the Google reviews online, same horror stories. I could tell my whole story but just look at all the 1 star reviews before me and you will know my story, exactly the same as what they say. Very dishonest unethical company.

google_reviews.author: Jennifer Craig
google_reviews.review: I have been a tenant under Integra for over a year and a half now, they have been seamless to work with, respond promptly if I need maintainence, always keep me in the loop on anything happening in my building. After dealing with other property management companies who were not responsive to maintainence requests, among other things, Integra is the breath of fresh air I truly needed. Thank you so much, Integra!

ownerResponse.text: Thank you for the kind words!!

google_reviews.author: Michele M.
google_reviews.review: Our 55+ community in Bellingham had two previous property management companies before Integra. Our HOA Board was very dissatisfied with those two previous companies; and very satisfied with Integra. As an owner, I have been impressed by Integra's excellent service, both from their office staff and the two owners (Tess & Cindy). They have always answered my questions quickly and efficiently. When I have attended Board meetings, I always observed the broad expertise, financial acumen, wide range of tradesmen contacts and overall professionalism of Integra's Tess as she helps our HOA Board work their way through their many duties, looking after our community. At our annual general meetings, Tess and Cindy have also demonstrated their understanding of owners' concerns; and Tess and Cindy's tact in dealing with a wide variety of owner personalities. I highly recommend Integra.

ownerResponse.text: Thank you for your kind words.

google_reviews.author: OnTheRoadAgain
google_reviews.review: Yes, yes, yes! Sadie Sullivan, the absolute most unprofessional of the bunch. No clue how to speak to homeowners. Thank you so much to all of the other reviewers who are posting about their negative experiences with this company. I am thinking these reviews should be sent to the better business bureau.  I could tell my entire story but it would be the exact same as every one of you. Worst customer service ever, they try their hardest not to fix anything or spend money in any way even when it's their legal responsibility. My experience with the maintenance guy they were using to respond to any repairs (Mike) was an absolute nightmare, and then rather than apologizing for everything, they defended him and blamed me! The worst experience I have ever had with a prop management company. I may have to file a homeowners insurance claim for something that is their responsibility to fix because they seem to be refusing to fix it. They are rude and belittling over the phone and email, even seem like they don't want to help you in person. I echo the sentiments of another reviewer who said they don't even want to give 1 star.

google_reviews.author: Mareyoko Butler
google_reviews.review:
I rented a condo in birch bay through Integra years ago and had the WORST experience I have EVER had with any kind of business of that kind. I always look back on it and laugh at the irony of their name. From my experience they are completely lacking in integrity. They did not inform me about the home owners association fees until I had already paid a down payment and i felt like I was surprised by other extra costs I was not originally informed about. The people I dealt with were rude. I got out of that lease as soon as I could. They did NOT make that easy and I lost a lot of money. That part is understandable except for the way it was handled was very bad. It is my belief they made it more difficult than need be out of spite (even though they were already making a profit off the extra fines and deposits, they also did not lose any rent). But I was not comfortable living under a management company like this. Losing some money was better than living under their thumb.

You would be wise to listen to your fellows and look elsewhere for a living situation.

google_reviews.author: Kat DeVaney
google_reviews.review:
We have had multiple interactions with Integra in which they have lost keys, blamed us for it, yelled at us and then told US that we were unprofessional, incorrectly identified who the owners of the property were, and generally have been very unpleasant to deal with.

Edit: September 2020. Cindy and Tess have threatened to drop our HOA as a client if I was elected to the board, and told our current board members Good Luck finding another property management company to take you. How much more unprofessional can you get?
They also took 6 months to resolve a simple ceiling tile that fell onto our walkway.

ownerResponse.text:
It is unfortunate that you lost your keys.  As we tried to explain, we have never had keys to your unit as it was on the master system and we had no need of them.  A key for you was located with the Board of Directors, of which you were already aware.

The Owners of the unit were correctly identified and are concurrent with those on the recorded title.  We cannot just add names to the account unless such is supported by legally recorded documents.

Unfortunately when your significant other was in our office, none of these answers were satisfactory for him.  He made his displeasure loudly known while exiting.

In response to your recent post about INTEGRA dropping the Association if you were on the Board, this is VERY interesting as you WERE on the 2019 ballot for the Board and the MEMBERSHIP rejected you NOT INTEGRA.

google_reviews.author: NJ GP

google_reviews.author: Dee Brown
google_reviews.review:
Awful company. I couldn't agree more with the previous reviewers.

Unfortunately, the damage has been done and my rating likely won't go much higher than this. After a horrible couple of days dealing with Tiffany and Tess, the owner, Cindyrae stepped in and we were able to find some common ground.

google_reviews.author: Ed DeVaney
google_reviews.review:
In response to Integra's response to Kat DeVaney:
Your response is simply false. It is plain you have no problem being dishonest with your customers. At your company's request, to accommodate fire inspections for which we would not be present, we have dropped off no fewer than three keys with your company, two of which you have no record of. These were handed to the secretary who promised to keep them on file, which never happened.
Regarding changing the owners of the property, it makes sense that someone would need to change the record in person. That is a reasonable request, and not the issue we had with your company. The problem we had was with Tess and Cindyrae, the owners of Integra. Your secretary and staff were fine, and looked embarrassed to be involved with this situation. Property management companies have a history of being falsely maligned. In this case your impatience in explaining the situation, the fact that you did not stay in the room to continue the conversation, instead choosing to scream names at me from the other room, and your unwillingness to even talk to me because my name was not on the document, instead making me call my mother-in-law (whose name was on the document), then refusing to talk to her once she was on the line; all of these issues are why we gave you a negative review.
Instead of taking responsibility for your actions as owners of the company, you choose to disparage your customers. This is why we call you unprofessional and rude.
I made my displeasure known calmly, without raising my voice. I told you I was frustrated, that I did not appreciate being yelled at from other rooms, and that I expected an apology. Apparently you interpret this as being loud. When no apology was forthcoming, I left.

google_reviews.author: Pres Play
google_reviews.review:
I'll preface by saying, based on my recent encounter with Integra I was quite shocked to see all the negative reviews. I can only presume that my positive experience with Integra is perhaps a result of that feedback and reflection on how a company should engage with it's customers or it's customer's customers.
Recently I had learned that my HOA had changed brokers, I also realized my HOA fees had not been getting deducted because of the change (technically my fault). I called Integra and the lady I spoke with gave me some good advice on options. About 20 minutes later I drive to their location and spoke with Sadie to determine the next steps of resolving my "faux pas"!  Sadie explained to me what I needed to do to get my account up to date. She was helpful, respectful and considerate of my situation. I had accumulated late fees due to the confusion and she explained to me the steps to take to request resolution without penalty from the HOA Board. I felt she went above and beyond in my situation, even facilitating the communication to the Board rather me having to write a letter and sending it in the mail. (way inconvenient!!! )

Anyway not to negate others experiences and frustrations, I feel its important for people to have a platform to express their dissatisfaction. I also think its important to give credit where credit is due, so Saide.....thank you very much for your help, I truly appreciated it.

google_reviews.author: Ms Down to earth

summary.text:
Good

In this article's "Good" section, we showcase the positives noted in the user reviews for Integra Condominium Association Management. Tenants who had pleasing experiences praise the company's quick responsiveness to maintenance requests and their ability to keep tenants informed about events occurring within their buildings. One user detailed a seamless experience with the staff, finding them efficient and appreciative of the office's overall professionalism, noting their quick response time as impressive. Another mentioned that Integra was a refreshing change from their past experiences with property management companies, indicating a notable level of satisfaction with the services received.

Great

The "Great" section of this article recognizes exceptional service that goes beyond the basics. Board members of associations managed by Integra have expressed a high degree of satisfaction with the company's professionalism and expertise in overseeing and planning necessary management tasks. Users commended the owners for their deep understanding of the concerns of homeowners and their effective facilitation of annual general meetings. Integra's handling of long-term relationships with some clients has also been noted as very professional, suggesting a solid track record of consistent service provision with certain clientele.

Bad

Turning to the "Bad" aspects, several user reviews pointed to Integra's inadequate attention to tenant and homeowner issues. Complaints include miscommunication and unresponsiveness to maintenance requests, as well as rudeness from staff members. One reviewer felt the company's practices were dishonest, citing a situation where application fees were collected for an apartment the potential tenant was never actually considered for. Moreover, many users reported a failure to return security deposits and the imposition of fines that accumulated to significantly higher expenses, suggesting a pattern of financial mismanagement that can burden tenants and homeowners alike.

U Let's continue to the "Ugly" subsection of the article. Unfortunately, some of the user reviews for Integra Condominium Association Management reflect alarming dissatisfaction. One user felt that Integra's tactic of disguising high HOA fees with regular assessments was deceptive and misleading to potential buyers. Another troubling allegation involved a property manager's attitude, described as making tenants feel like they were deceiving the company when raising legitimate concerns. The culmination of numerous negative experiences shared in user reviews paints a picture of a company that may neglect its duties, struggle with poor communication, and display questionable ethics.
